abstract: What is currently known about the orbital debris flux is from a combination of ground based and in-space measurements. These measurements have revealed an increasing population with decreasing size. A summary of measurements is presented for the following sources: the North American Aerospace Defense Command Catalog, the Perimeter Acquisition and Attack Characterization System Radar, ground based optical telescopes, the Explorer 46 Meteoroid Bumper Experiment, spacecraft windows, and Solar Max surfaces.
title: Orbital debris measurements

organization.name: NASA Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center

publications.publicationName: Lunar and Planetary Inst. Trajectory Determinations and Collection of Micxrometeoroids on the Space Station

related.title: Trajectory determinations and collection of micrometeoroids on the space station. Report of the Workshop on Micrometeorite Capture Experiments
